We dive further into the branch of non-defective squaren×nmatrices.
Ais normal if the condition A⊤A= AA⊤holds. Moreover, if the more
restrictive condition holds that A⊤A = AA⊤ = I, then Ais called or-
thogonal (see Deﬁnition 3.8). The set of orthogonal matrices is a subset of
the regular (invertible) matrices and satisﬁes A⊤= A−1.
Normal matrices have a frequently encountered subset, the symmetric
matrices S∈Rn×n, which satisfy S= S⊤. Symmetric matrices have only
